undecided
Class PlayerTank

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      undecided.PlayerTank

public class PlayerTank
extends java.util.Observable

This class is the tank object that is controlled by the player that can be moved by arrow keys and shoot independently via the mouse. It contains the tanks location, health, and shape that detects collisions.

Author:
Team Exception
See Also:
EnemyTank, TankView, Items, Observable

Returns:
the current speed of the PlayerTank

moveUp

public boolean moveUp()
This method moves (if possible) the PlayerTank one unit in the up direction. It will take into account whether it is destroyed by moving into a FireRing or SpikePit, and will adjust the image of the tank depending on whether it has a BubbleShield, IceBlock or neither. It will also choose the tank image that is facing North.

Returns:
whether it has successfully moved up

moveDown

public boolean moveDown()
This method moves (if possible) the PlayerTank one unit in the down direction. It will take into account whether it is destroyed by moving into a FireRing or SpikePit, and will adjust the image of the tank depending on whether it has a BubbleShield, IceBlock or neither. It will also choose the tank image that is facing South.

Returns:
whether it has successfully moved down

moveRight

public boolean moveRight()
This method moves (if possible) the PlayerTank one unit in the right direction. It will take into account whether it is destroyed by moving into a FireRing or SpikePit, and will adjust the image of the tank depending on whether it has a BubbleShield, IceBlock or neither. It will also choose the tank image that is facing EAST.

Returns:
whether it has successfully moved right

if BubbleShield is active on the PlayerTank

moveLeft

public boolean moveLeft()
This method moves (if possible) the PlayerTank one unit in the left direction. It will take into account whether it is destroyed by moving into a FireRing or SpikePit, and will adjust the image of the tank depending on whether it has a BubbleShield, IceBlock or neither. It will also choose the tank image that is facing West.

Returns:
whether it has successfully moved left

shoot

public void shoot(Point p,
                  int x,
                  int y)
This method determines the direction of the tank and shoots a single animated projectile in the appropriate direction. The direction may be diagonally, having an x and y direction.

Parameters:
p - current location of the projectile
x - horizontal component speed of the projectile
y - vertical component speed of the projectile

recieveDamage

public void recieveDamage(int damage)
This method will deal damage to the PlayerTank according to the input parameter value.

Parameters:
damage - this is the damage that the player controlled tank is to receive

isDead

public boolean isDead()
THis method will determine if the PlayerTank is dead.

Returns:
whether PlayerTank has no health
